page.title: 17Uffington village hall
page.content: The village hall in Uffington is over 200 years old. The village hall used to be called the church room and it was owned by the Litchfield Diocese Trust which is a collection of parishes.A kitchen,and toilets have recently been built.Also they have recently put a new roof on the building. The village hall can be hired any day of the week if needed. The village hall is used for keep fit classes,parties,weddings,occasionally whist drives,church meetings,parish council meetings,village fetes and the village committee meetings. The hall has a kitchen with a cooker and hot and cold water.It has toilets with hot and cold water as well.
